entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 10 at 12:17PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Warm, moist air will continue to spread north across a stalled frontal zone extending from the Laurel Highlands into northern and central West Virginia. This boundary will be the focus for numerous showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening, which will have the potential to produce very heavy rainfall. entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 4:03PM EDT until September 10 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN RALEIGH COUNTY... At 403 PM EDT, Previous thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. Flooding has been reported in the city of Beckley.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 10 at 12:17PM EDT until September 10 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Warm, moist air will continue to spread north across a stalled frontal zone extending from the Laurel Highlands into northern and central West Virginia. This boundary will be the focus for numerous showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening, which will have the potential to produce very heavy rainfall. entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CAMPBELL AND NORTHWESTERN CROOK COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 251 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Lightning Flat, or 29 miles southeast of Broadus, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
